value.title: Connect and analyze your Dynamics 365 data​
value.excerpt: Connect and analyze your Dynamics 365 Data​

value.title: Explore what Power BI can do for you
value.excerpt: As a consumer, you'll work in the Power BI service to review and interact with content that has been shared with you. This module provides the foundational information that you need to work effectively in the Power BI service.

value.title: Append and Merge Tables in Power BI
value.excerpt: Learn how to quickly merge and append tables using the query editior in Power BI. Build models with multiple data sources. Contact me on LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/in/gaelimholland
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/CW-Er8slv9k" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Machine Learning in Power BI
value.excerpt: We can utilize Python and Scikit-Learn machine algorithms in Power with the Run Script option. In this example we will do churn analysis using an classification with the Logistic Regression package from Scikit_learn.  Check me out on LinkedIn   https://www.linkedin.com/in/gaelimholland

value.title: Year over Year and Month over Month Calculations in Power BI
value.excerpt: Learn how to quickly produce time intelligence calcution in Power BI using these easy to follow DAX equations. Elevate your time series analysis.

Calculated column vs measure video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SmXLgEHXSGc  Vertipag (DAX engine

value.title: #41 Understanding relationships in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: You normally build relationships in Power BI (connect two tables together) so you can work with the data in both tables as if they were a single table.  In this video you will learn how to create relationships, understand what and how to use the advance options and troubleshoot the most common problems.
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/-4ybWQSRcOY" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Building relationships between tables when both have duplicates
value.excerpt: PowerPivot and Power BI Desktop only allow the creation of relationships between tables when one of columns forming the relationship does not have duplicate values.  In order to relate these two tables to one another, what we need is a third table with all distinct values from both tables. In this tutorial
